summary:
A HELPFUL QUICK ENB REFERENCE:
Written for those new to ENB, as well as for those with years of experience.
It provides more than just basic info of what each ENB configuration setting does, but it provides tips on what other settings will compliment that setting. More than 800 lines of settings are covered in this comprehensi
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]http://s8.postimg.org/hb1yq7exh/banner.jpg[/img][/center]


[color=#ffff00][center][b]THANK YOU FOR DOWNLOADING AND ENDORSING THIS FILE![/b][/center][/color]

People have asked how I got Skyrim to look the way it does in my screenshots. So I decided to teach people how to setup and configure ENB so that it will look its best. I wish everyone the best, and I really hope this is a helpful guide. There are two file formats to choose: Pdf or Word.

[color=#ffff00][b]A Necessary Resource for ENB Users:[/b][/color]
This guide provides a huge wealth of advice and tips. You will learn how to verify that ENB is up and running. Then the guide will walk you through how each ENB setting affects the game. It provides more than just basic info of what each ENB configuration setting does. It provides lots of advice on what setting compliment other settings, and how to get the most from each setting. For example, you'll learn to understand the importance of AmbientColorCurve and its relationship with DirectLightingingIntesity, then you'll be shown how to problem solve using this knowledge.

The Guide also provides advice on trouble areas to avoid, as well as strong areas to take advantage of. More than 800 lines of settings are covered in this comprehensive Guide. I WILL TRY TO UPDATE THIS GUIDE WEEKLY. So keep coming back to get a free one.

This is even better with my other files: 
 [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59286/?][b]JW's High Quality ENB Preset[/b][/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59286/?][b] [/b][/url][b][url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59292/?][b]JW's Skyrim Configuration Files[/b][/url][/b]   Check them out. You're gonna love them.
*** Another file will help ENB Users get more Frame Per Second. Read the description and look at the pictures first: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/59305/?][b]SKYRIM PERFORMANCE BOOSTER[/b][/url]


{This File will be updated often because I want it to be the ultimate Skyrim ENB Guide.}

[size=4]In this Guide, I use the words [ON] and [OFF] to represent the "check marks" you will use in the ENB Configuration Window. If you want to manually copy these into your ENBSERIES.INI, you will have to change [ON] to true and [OFF] to false .[/size]

Here is MY List of recommended Mods. I think they're in the correct install order:
[color=#E981F7]
1. Skyrim main files

2. all skyrim unofficial patches and then Climates of Tamriel

3. static mesh improvements

4. moss rocks

5. HD Ivy - Original Green

6.  Skyrim_HighPoly_Fern_Meshes

7. Enhanced Wetness and Puddles-46915-1-1  (after the rain, as you see the dew drops)

8. Skyrim Flora Overhaul  {Alpha Update}

9. Enhanced Lighting and Effects

10. supreme Fogs

11.  Particle Patch All-In-One, and SUBSURFACE SCATTERING PATCH, and  HIGH
POLY  FERN MESHES 
http://enbseries.enbdev.com/forum/viewtopic.php?t=1499

12. Sharpshooters ENB (wrapper version) WITH ENB VERSION .254

13. SMAA Injection (injection.ini:  preset = SMAA_PRESET_CLOD_ULTRA)

14. Unique grasses and Ground covers: http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/42370/?

15. Ground Covers Plugin: http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/54196/?

16. Realistic Lighting, then Realistic Lighting Patcher

***NOTE:  FOR THE SUPERCHARGED VERSION OF THIS LIST, DOWNLOAD MY SKYRIM PERFORMANCE BOOSTER. I guaranteed your Skyrim will be Rock Solid Stable if you follow that list and don't install any other mods, except a few body enhancement mods. And make sure your skyrim.ini, skyrimPrefs.ini, are both compatible to your particular computer system.
[/color]

      [color=#ffff00][center][b]A wealth of gratitude goes out to the mod artists in the List above![/b][/center][/color]
[size=4]
[color=#ffff00][b]UPDATE ON STATUS
[/b][/color][/size]I have updated files to my other mods, and unfortunately neglected this one. WELL, not quite. :)
Actually, I have created about 30 pages of ENB notes in a personal notebook. I just need to write them into the ENB Guide here. I will work on doing that.
author: Jenna Watson
